titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Charles Wicke and Andrew Straus, Abstract
CWG4354

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Jefferson Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Ky Plffs
against
Charles Wicke & Andrew Straus

Charles Wicke had an examination on a charge of Felony in the city Court of Louisville, was held to answer, and on the 29 day of Sept 1855. was held to ans he entered into a reconizance in the sum of $800, with Andrew Straus as his Surety in a like Sum.
On the 20th of December 1855 the reconizance and was forfeited as follows viz:

"This day came the Commonwealth by her attorney and the Defendent being Solemly called to appear in discharge of this reconizance entered into by him in the city court of Louisville on the 29th day of Sept. 1855. with Andrew Straus his bail in the sum of eight hundred dollars each, came not, but made default. It is therefore ordered that the clerk of this Court issue writs of Scirefacias Severally against the Said Charles Wicke and Andrew Straus his bail, returnable to the
next term of this court commanding them to appear and Show cause if any they have or can why the Said Commonwealth Shall not have Judgment and Execution thereon against them for the Sum of one thousand dollars each according to the form and effect of Said reconizance, and for a breach of the condition thereof. And then on the Plaintiff's motion a capias is awarded herein against the Defendent returnable; which capias is ordered to be endorsed, that Defendent may, upon the execution thereof enter into reconizance himself in the Sum of eight hundred dollars with good and Sufficient bail in the like Sum conditioned for his personal appearance according to the commence of Said capias. And all further proceedings are continued until the next term of this court."

A copy att
Jas P Chambers C. J. C. C
The case was continue a few terms and then was droped informally from the docket.
On the 14th day of Oct. 1863. a Scirefacias issued against Defendents Wicke and Andred Straus as follows. viz
"The Commonwealth of Kentucky To the Sheriff of Jefferson County.

You are commanded to Summon Charles Wicke, together with Andrew Straus his bail to appear before the Judge of the Jefferson Circuit Court, at the court house in the city of Louisville on the first day of Jefferson the October Term of Said court, to Show cause if any they have or can why the Commonwealth Shall not have Judgment and execution against them for eight hundred dollars each by reason of the forfeiture of a reconizance entered into by them in the city court of Louisville on the 29th day of September 1855. And have then and there this writ.
Witness James P Chambers clerk of Said court at the court house aforesaid this 14th day of October 1863."

James P. Chambers, clerk
On this is the following return viz:

"Executive on A. Straus. October 15, 1863.
Charles Wick not found.
James Malona D. S. for W. A. Ronald S. J. C."

A Copy
att Jas P Chambers C. J. C. C
